theorem_name: Positive Definite Kernel Implies Critical Line

theorem_statement.natural: If K(x,y) is a positive definite kernel, then all non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function lie on the critical line Re(s) = 1/2
theorem_statement.spanish: Si K(x,y) es positivo definido, entonces todos los ceros no triviales de ζ(s) tienen Re(s) = 1/2

dependencies: Theorem: Spectral Theorem for Self-Adjoint Operators

step_4.justification: D(s) = D(1-s) with λ = ρ(1-ρ) real forces Re(ρ) = 1/2

philosophical_foundation.english: Reality vibrates with harmony because its nucleus is neither negative nor chaotic. If the heart of the field maintains positive coherence, then discontinuities (zeros) cannot escape from the critical line of maximum symmetry.
philosophical_foundation.noetic_interpretation: The positivity of the kernel represents fundamental coherence in the noetic field. The critical line Re(s) = 1/2 is not merely a mathematical constraint but the locus of maximum symmetry where information collapses coherently.
